intro: Dicranacanthus spinicyma, commonly known as the spiny leaf fern, is a unique vascular plant characterized by its distinctive morphology. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. The plant features elongated, serrated fronds that are covered in small, spiny structures, giving it its common name. Its reproductive structures are borne on the underside of the fronds, typical of ferns. Dicranacanthus spinicyma thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in forest undergrowth.
